info.title: Inventory API
info.description: Inventory microservice exposes REST APIs that are necessary to maintain and access the Safe Drinking Water systems inventory for Primacy Agencies.

put.summary: This endpoint adds or updates a water system wholesale at a selling water system within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. If the request body contains a previously made association(id specified in the request body), the request will update it. If the association id is not present (existing association id is null) it will attempt to create a new association. This operation requires the user to have write permissions to the related regulating agency of the water system.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the seller water system to which the wholesale is attached.

200.description: response will contain the water system wholesale with the information related to the receiving and selling water systems and facility information attached.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

409.description: response will contain the conflict error code stating that either the water system wholesale being attempted to insert, already exists or being updated can not be updated to become a duplicate of a different existing record.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the selling water system record not found.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid or user does not have sufficient regulating agency write access.

put.summary: This endpoint adds or updates a water system purchase at a receiving water system within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. If the request body contains a previously made association(id specified in the request body), the request will update it. If the association id is not present (existing association id is null) it will attempt to create a new association. This operation requires the user to have write permissions to the related regulating agency of the water system.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the buyer water system to which the purchase is attached.

200.description: response will contain the water system purchase with the information related to the receiving and selling water systems and facility information attached.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

409.description: response will contain the conflict error code stating that either the water system purchase being attempted to insert, already exists or being updated can not be updated to become a duplicate of a different existing record.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid or user does not have sufficient regulating agency write access.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the receiving water system record not found.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves an existing water system service line records by the specified criteria within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system.

parameters.name: waterSystemServiceLineId
parameters.description: Water system service line id.

parameters.name: wsServiceLineDataTypeId
parameters.description: Water system service line data type id.

parameters.name: wsServiceLineTypeId
parameters.description: Water system service line type id.

parameters.name: numOfLines
parameters.description: Water system service line num of lines.

parameters.name: beginDateFrom
parameters.description: The beginning date of the range for Water system service line begin date to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: beginDateTo
parameters.description: The end date of the range for Water system service line start date to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: endDateFrom
parameters.description: The beginning date of the range for Water system Service line end date to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: endDateTo
parameters.description: The end date of the range for Water system Service end date to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system record represented by the id is not found.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid or the user does not have at least read only access to at least one of the regulating agencies associated with the water system.

200.description: response will contain the water system service line records satisfying the criteria.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

put.summary: This endpoint adds or updates a water system service lines at a water system within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. If the request body contains a previously made association(id specified in the request body), the request will update it. If the association id is not present (existing association id is null) it will attempt to create a new association. This operation requires the user to have write permissions to the related regulating agency of the water system.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system to which the service lines is attached.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid or user does not have sufficient regulating agency write access.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

200.description: response will contain the water system with the updated list of service lines and other associations.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system record not found.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

delete.summary: This endpoint soft deletes one or more existing water system service lines of a water system within the  user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: Water system number of which the service line have to be removed.

202.description: response will contain the deleted service lines missing in the list of water system service lines in the water system. If any of the individual item could not be deleted a warning will be added to the response.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

404.description: response will say that the water system does not exist.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid or the user does not have write access to at least one regulating agency associated with the water system.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves summary information of existing water system and regulating agency associations within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: raWSAssocId
parameters.description: id of the regulating agency and water system association to be fetched.

parameters.name: raLegalEntityId
parameters.description: id of the regulating agency.

parameters.name: agencyName
parameters.description: Name of the regulating agency which is related to a water system that needs to be filtered. This filter acts as a starts with filter.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: Water system id to be filtered. This a starts with filter which can take parts of words as input and compare if that the field value starts with this text.

parameters.name: agencyTypeCode
parameters.description: Type the water system-legal entity poc type code to be filtered. This filter can accept exact match.

parameters.name: paEstablishNum
parameters.description: PA establish number to be filtered. This is a starts with filter.

parameters.name: createDateFrom
parameters.description: Start date limit of the create date filter criteria to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: createDateTo
parameters.description: End date limit of the create date filter criteria to be filtered.  This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Number of the current page of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Size of the current pages of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: sortColumns
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort column names. Available values are "waterSystemId", "agencyName","agencyTypeCode,", and "createDt".

parameters.name: sortOrders
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort orders. The number of values in the list must match the number of values in the list of sortColumns. Available values are "ASC" and "DESC".

400.description: response will contain the error information if the input parameters are of invalid lengths, format or errorneous.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid or the user does not have at least read only access to at least one of the regulating agencies associated with the water system.

200.description: response will contain the legal Entity and regulating agency associations related information if it is available.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

put.summary: This endpoint adds or updates one or more  related water system and regulating agency association at a water system within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. If the request body contains a previously made association(id specified in the request body), the request will update it. If the association id is not present (existing association id is null) it will attempt to create a new association. An attempt to make this request with , regulating agency id of a different existing association without specifying the association id in the request would result in a conflict and will be treated as an attempt to add a duplicate. If the same record is already attached but in deleted state, it will be marked as undeleted. When updating is done, if null columns are sent as null they will be marked as null (allowing ability to erase). If it is a not null field sent as null this operation will ignore it assuming that user did not want to re-specify.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system to which the regulating agency association should be attached.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid. This status could be returned with an error code if the current user does not have write access permission to the regulating agency.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

200.description: response will contain the water system with the current state point of regulating agency association.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system record not found.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves summary information of existing water system legal entity points of contact within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: leWSPOCId
parameters.description: id of the legal entity water system point of contact to be fetched.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the legal entity which is a point of contact that needs to be filtered. This filter acts as a starts with filter.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: Water system id to be filtered. This a starts with filter which can take parts of words as input and compare if that the field value starts with this text.

parameters.name: wsLEPOCTypeCode
parameters.description: Type the water system-legal entity poc type code to be filtered. This filter can accept exact match.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Type the poc legal entity status code to be filtered. This filter can accept exact match.

parameters.name: organizationName
parameters.description: Name of the related organization to be filtered. This filter acts as a starts with filter.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number of the POC to be filtered. This filter acts as a starts with filter.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: Email address of the POC to be filtered. This filter acts as an exact match with filter.

parameters.name: legalEntityId
parameters.description: id of the legal entity of the point of contact to be fetched.

parameters.name: startFromDate
parameters.description: Start date limit of the start date filter criteria to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: startToDate
parameters.description: End date limit of the start date filter criteria to be filtered.  This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: endFromDate
parameters.description: Start limt date of the end date filter criteria to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: endToDate
parameters.description: End date limit of the end date filter criteria to be filtered.  This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Number of the current page of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Size of the current pages of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: sortColumns
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort column names. Available values are "statusCode", "wsLEPOCTypeCode","name","statusCode","waterSystemId", "legalEntityId", and "createDt".

parameters.name: sortOrders
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort orders. The number of values in the list must match the number of values in the list of sortColumns. Available values are "ASC" and "DESC".

200.description: response will contain the legal Entity and contact related information if it is available.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid or the user does not have at least read only access to at least one of the regulating agencies associated with the water system.

404.description: response will contain not found error static that the water system is not found.

400.description: response will contain the error information if the input parameters are of invalid lengths, format or errorneous.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

put.summary: This endpoint adds or updates a related point of contact association at a water system within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. If the request body contains a previously made association(id specified in the request body), the request will update it. If the association id is not present (existing association id is null) it will attempt to create a new association. An attempt to make this request with poc type, legal entity address id of a different existing association without specifying the association id in the request would result in a conflict and will be treated as an attempt to add a duplicate. If the same record is already attached but in deleted state, it will be marked as undeleted. When updating is done, if null columns are sent as null they will be marked as null (allowing ability to erase). If it is a not null field sent as null this operation will ignore it assuming that user did not want to re-specify.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system to which the POC should be attached.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid or user does not have sufficient regulating agency write access.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

409.description: response will contain the conflict error code stating the user is attempting to add a duplicate POC record. This can happen if the user did not specify the leWSPOCId in the request body but provided other field values which would match against an existing association.

200.description: response will contain the water system with the current state point of contact association.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system record not found.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

post.summary: Submits an action message to process the nitrate applicability rule for the process primacy agency. This data is only available within the scope of the primacy agency specified by the current partner id.

200.description: response will contain the success or failed status in result summary.

400.description: response will contain the error information if the input parameters are of invalid lengths, format or errorneous.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid, or if token is not valid.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves an existing water system by the id user within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system to be fetched.

200.description: response will contain the water system and associated information.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system record represented by the id is not found.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid or the user does not have read access to at least one regulating agency which is associated with the water system.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

delete.summary: This endpoint soft deletes an existing water system within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system to be deleted.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid. Also if the user does not have write access to at least one regulating agency associated with the water system this error status may be returned.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

202.description: response will contain null reference for the water system which has been deleted.

404.description: response will say that the water system does not exist.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

patch.summary: This endpoint updates an existing water system record within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. This update only addresses changes to the water system record only and not its child elements. If a non mandatory attribute is missing in the request body, this assumes that the caller intends to clear the value of that attribute. If a mandatory attribute in the water system is not specified in the update request body this assumes that the missing field should not be updated.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system to be updated.

401.description: response will say The user does not have permission to access this method. This can happen if the user does not have sufficient permission to invoke this method, the token is invalid or if the token is expired or the user does not have write access to at least one regulating agency associated with the water system.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

200.description: response will contain the updated water system record.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system does not exists.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves water system facility id within the regulating agencies to which the user has at least read permissions which exists within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. If the user has not selected these preferences in the user profile the user will not be able to search water systems.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: Water system number of which the facility has to be search.

parameters.name: facilityId
parameters.description: facility id which should be search.

400.description: response will contain the error information if the input parameters are of invalid lengths, format or errorneous.

200.description: response will contain the search facility id missing in the list of facility in the water system.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

patch.summary: This endpoint updates an existing water system facility record within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. This update only addresses changes to the water system facility record and its location, storage, well information only, and not its child elements. If a non mandatory attribute is missing in the request body, this assumes that the caller intends to clear the value of that attribute. If a mandatory attribute in the water system facility is not specified in the update request body this assumes that the missing field should not be updated.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system whoes facility needs to be updated.

parameters.name: facilityId
parameters.description: facility id of the facility which should be updated.

409.description: response will say that the paAssignedId has been already allocated to a different facility.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system or the facility does not exists.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

401.description: response will say The user does not have permission to access this method. This can happen if the user does not have sufficient permission to invoke this method, the token is invalid or if the token is expired or the user does not have write access to at least one regulating agency associated with the water system.

200.description: response will contain the updated water system facility record.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

patch.summary: This endpoint updates an existing water system record's comment within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: id of the water system of which the comment to be updated.

401.description: response will say The user does not have permission to access this method. This can happen if the user does not have sufficient permission to invoke this method, the token is invalid or if the token is expired or the user does not have write access to at least one regulating agency associated with the water system.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

200.description: response will contain the updated water system record.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the water system does not exists.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves an existing static water system group owned by the user within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the static water system group to be fetched.

200.description: response will contain the static water system group and associated information.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the static water system group record represented by the id that is owned by the current user is not found.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid.

patch.summary: This endpoint updates an existing static water system group record within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the water system group to be updated.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

200.description: response will contain the updated water system group record.

409.description: response will say the water system group cannot be updated to become a duplicate of an existing record. This can happen if the user attempts to update to the name used by an existing different record.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the static water system group owned by this user does not exists.

401.description: response will say The user does not have permission to access this method. This can happen if the user does not have sufficient permission to invoke this method, the token is invalid or if the token is expired.

patch.summary: This endpoint changes the ownership of an existing water system group record owned by the current user to a new owner within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the water system group to be updated.

parameters.name: ownerUserId
parameters.description: id of the to be owner user to be filtered. This filter can accept parts of the words to form a contains filter.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

200.description: response will contain the updated water system group record with new owner's id.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

409.description: response will say the water system group cannot be updated to become a duplicate of an existing record. This can happen if the user attempts to update to the name used by an existing different record.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the static water system group owned by this user does not exists.

401.description: response will say The user does not have permission to access this method. This can happen if the user does not have sufficient permission to invoke this method, the token is invalid or if the token is expired.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves an existing dynamic water system group owned by the user within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the dynamic water system group to be fetched.

200.description: response will contain the dynamic water system group and associated information.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the dynamic water system group record represented by the id that is owned by the current user is not found.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid.

patch.summary: This endpoint updates an existing dynamic water system group record within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the water system group to be updated.

400.description: response will say that it is a bad request.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

200.description: response will contain the updated water system group record.

409.description: response will say the water system group cannot be updated to become a duplicate of an existing record. This can happen if the user attempts to update to the name used by an existing different record.

404.description: response will contain the error code and description stating that the dynamic water system group owned by this user does not exists.

401.description: response will say The user does not have permission to access this method. This can happen if the user does not have sufficient permission to invoke this method, the token is invalid or if the token is expired.

get.summary: fetches a list of existing water system types. This data is only available within the scope of the primacy agency.

parameters.name: wsTypeCode
parameters.description: The Water system type code filter, an exact match can be used to filter the values.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the water system type to be filtered. This filter can accept parts of the words to form a contains filter.

parameters.name: createFromDate
parameters.description: Start date of the create filter criteria to be filtered. This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: createToDate
parameters.description: End date of the create filter criteria to be filtered.  This date should be specified in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss[.SSS] format.

parameters.name: notArchived
parameters.description: notArchived optional flag to be filtered. This filter can accept exact match. If this filter is not available in the query, the search results will present all records based on the rest of the criteria. The value Y would ensure that the search result will eliminate the archived records in the results. The value N will return only the archived records.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Number of the current page of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Size of the current pages of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: sortColumns
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort column names. Available values are "wsTypeCode" and "name".

parameters.name: sortOrders
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort orders. The number of values in the list must match the number of values in the list of sortColumns. Available values are "ASC" and "DESC".

200.description: response will contain the water system type record list if it is available.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid, or if token is not valid.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

400.description: response will contain the error information if the input parameters are of invalid lengths, format or errorneous.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves water system purchase and wholesale report within the regulating agencies to which the user has at least read permissions which exists within the user's Primacy Agency workspace. The user should have atleast read permissions to one of the regulating agencies attached to the water system for which this report is generated.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: Water system id to be filtered. The list of purchases will have this id pattern as the buyer. The list of wholesale contains this id pattern as the seller .This a contains filter which can take parts of words as input and compare if that the field value contains this text.

parameters.name: sellerWaterSystemId
parameters.description: Seller Water system id to be filtered. This filter will be applied only to the purchase list.This a contains filter which can take parts of words as input and compare if that the field value contains this text.

parameters.name: sellerFacilityId
parameters.description: Seller facility id filter which is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: buyerWaterSystemId
parameters.description: Buyer Water system id to be filtered. This filter will be applied only to the purchase list.This a contains filter which can take parts of words as input and compare if that the field value contains this text.

parameters.name: buyerFacilityId
parameters.description: Seller facility id filter which is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: sellerWaterSystemName
parameters.description: Seller Water system facility name to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

parameters.name: sellerFacilityName
parameters.description: Seller facility name to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves the federal water system type recommended by the decision management service for an existing water system available within the user's Primacy Agency workspace.

parameters.description: id of the water system.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

400.description: response will state that the input is malformed due to field length format errors or any information provided for the child elements to be added is incorrect or not found.

404.description: response will contain the error code stating the water system represented by the path variable is not available.

401.description: response will contain the error code stating the user is unauthorized to perform this request, or if token is not valid.

get.summary: This endpoint retrieves potential static water system group member list for a given user based on the user's regulating agencies. If the user has at least read permission to a regulating agency, which is related to a water system, that water system will appear in the results. This ignores all other implicit filters such as current water system group or current regulating agency preference.

parameters.name: waterSystemId
parameters.description: Water system id to be filtered. This a contains filter which can take parts of words as input and compare if that the field value matches with this text.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Water system name to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

parameters.name: wsStatusCode
parameters.description: Water system status code to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: fedWSSourceCode
parameters.description: Fed Water system source code to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: fedWSTypeCode
parameters.description: Fed Water system type code to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: paWSTypeCode
parameters.description: Primacy Agency system type code to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: countyWSGeoAreaId
parameters.description: Id of country geographic area.

parameters.name: countyName
parameters.description: Country geographic area name to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: localName
parameters.description: Water system local name to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

parameters.name: altPANumber
parameters.description: Water system alternate PA number name to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

parameters.name: fedPopulationFrom
parameters.description: Fed population range from value.

parameters.name: fedPopulationTo
parameters.description: Fed population range to value.

parameters.name: grandTotalPopulationFrom
parameters.description: The grandTotalPopulationFrom to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

parameters.name: grandTotalPopulationTo
parameters.description: The grandTotalPopulationTo to be filtered. This is a contains filter.

parameters.name: fedTotalWholesalePopulationFrom
parameters.description: Fed total wholesale population range from value.

parameters.name: fedTotalWholesalePopulationTo
parameters.description: Fed total wholesale population range to value.

parameters.name: fedTotalDirectPopulationFrom
parameters.description: Fed total direct population range from value.

parameters.name: fedTotalDirectPopulationTo
parameters.description: Fed total direct population range to value.

parameters.name: fedIndirectWholesalePopulationFrom
parameters.description: Fed indirect wholesale population range from value.

parameters.name: fedIndirectWholesalePopulationTo
parameters.description: Fed indirect population range to value.

parameters.name: wsOwnerTypeCode
parameters.description: Water system owner type code to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: regulatingAgencyIds
parameters.description: Regulating agency legal entity ids as a comma delimited list.

parameters.name: seasonalInd
parameters.description: Seasonal indicator to be filtered. This is an exact match filter.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Number of the current page of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Size of the current pages of the paginated data to be displayed.

parameters.name: sortColumns
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort column names. Available values are "name", "paWSTypeCode", "waterSystemId", "wsStatusCode", "fedWSTypeCode", "fedWSSourceCode", "fedDirectWholesalePopulation", "fedIndirectWholesalePopulation", "fedPopulation","grandTotalPopulation", "fedTotalWholesalePopulation", "seasonalInd","wsOwnerTypeCode","localName", and "createDt".

parameters.name: sortOrders
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of sort orders. The number of values in the list must match the number of values in the list of sortColumns. Available values are "ASC" and "DESC".

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

200.description: response will contain the water system list after applying the user's list of regulating agencies as an implicit filter and explicit filters will be returned. If no data is available, an empty result will be returned with the success response.

400.description: response will contain the error information if the input parameters are of invalid lengths, format or errorneous.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid.

parameters.description: id of the water system group to be deleted.

404.description: response will say that the water system group that is owned by this user does not exist.

202.description: response will contain null reference for the water system group which has been deleted.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

404.description: response will say that the static water system group owned by this user does not exist.

202.description: response will contain the deleted member missing in the list of members in the water system group.

500.description: response will contain the error code and description.

401.description: response will contain access denied error if the user does not have permission to invoke this method, or if token is not valid.

404.description: response will say that the dynamic water system group owned by this user does not exist.

delete.summary: Delete one or more related-facility associations from a facility sampling point
delete.description: Removes only the association rows in dwp_related_sample_point for the given sampling point. It does not delete the primary facility of the sampling point.

500.description: Server error; response will contain error code and description.

401.description: User is unauthorized to perform this request.

200.description: Response contains the result summary and any warnings about IDs not found/already removed.
